alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Taylor; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 23 at 3:13AM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Blizzard Conditions Still Possible... .Winds will increase later today and remain strong into tonight with gusts of 45 to 50 mph expected at times. This may be enough to produce blizzard conditions and whiteouts, especially across southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa and the open area of western into north-central Wisconsin. Wind chills will remain dangerously to bitterly cold through tonight. Wind chills will be the coldest this morning with values of 35 to 45 below zero. Frostbite can occur in as little as 10 minutes in these conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 AM CST early this morning. For the Blizzard Warning, from 6 AM this morning to 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on deteriorating travel conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
